packagegui.title: Proxy Server: Traffic Management

field.description: Limit the maximum total download size to the size specified here (in kilobytes). Set to 0 to disable.
Limit the maximum total upload size to the size specified here (in kilobytes). Set to 0 to disable.

This value specifies the bandwidth throttle for downloads (in kilobytes per second). Users will gradually have their download speed decreased according to this value.
Set to 0 to disable.
This value specifies the download throttling per host. Set to 0 to disable.
If enabled, even 'Unrestricted IPs' configured on the ACLs tab are subject to throttling.
Leave this checked to be able to choose the extensions that throttling will be applied to. Otherwise, all files will be throttled.
Check this to apply bandwidth throttle to binary files. This includes compressed archives and executables.
Check this to apply bandwidth throttle to CD/DVD image files.
Check this to apply bandwidth throttle to multimedia files, such as movies or songs.
Comma-separated list of extensions to apply bandwidth throttle to.

The cache by default continues downloading aborted requests which are almost completed. This may be undesirable on slow links and/or very busy caches. Impatient users may tie up file descriptors and bandwidth by repeatedly requesting and immediately aborting downloads. When the user aborts a request, Squid will compare the below values to the amount of data transferred so far.

If you do not want any retrieval to continue after the client has aborted, set both values below to 0.
If you want retrievals to always continue if they are being cached, set 'Finish transfer if less than x KB remaining' to -1.

field.fielddescr: Finish transfer if less than x KB remaining
field.description: If the transfer has less than x KB remaining, it will finish the retrieval.

field.fielddescr: Abort transfer if more than x KB remaining
field.description: If the transfer has more than x KB remaining, it will abort the retrieval.

field.fielddescr: Finish transfer if more than x % finished
field.description: If more than x % of the transfer has completed, it will finish the retrieval.
